medium: Black chalk on laid gray-green paper (counterproof)
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895
inscribed: Inscribed recto, lower left, in gray ink: A. Caraglia; inscribed recto, lower right, in an unidentifiable and damaged stamp or text in black: UgR; inscribed verso, lower center, in graphite: L 13 CF Caraglio (1500-1570)/ Goldstein #132/ Ex McCartney

texts.textentryhtml: damaged and unidentified mark, lower right; Max A. Goldstein (Lugt 2842) lower right verso; Dan Fellows Platt (Lugt supp. 750a) lower left verso, bought as Caraglio at Goldstein sale (New York, American Art Assocation, 2-5 March 1920), no. 132, ex McCartney collection

bibliography.boilertext: Nicholas Turner, "Review of "catalogue of Italian drawings in the Art Museum", Princeton University by Felton Gibbons," Art bulletin 62, no. 3 (Sept., 1980), p. 486-490.
bibliography.citation:
Nicholas Turner, "Review of "catalogue of Italian drawings in the Art Museum", Princeton University by Felton Gibbons," Art bulletin 62, no. 3 (Sept., 1980), p. 486-490.
, p. 489

bibliography.boilertext: Robert Cahn, "A Counterproof from a Drawing of the Lateran Saint Philip," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University, vol. 38, no. 1 (1979): 11–13.
bibliography.citation:
Robert Cahn, "A Counterproof from a Drawing of the Lateran Saint Philip," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University, vol. 38, no. 1 (1979): 11–13.
, fig. 2, p. 12 (illus.)

bibliography.boilertext: Felton Gibbons, Catalogue of Italian Drawings in The Art Museum, Princeton University, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1977).
